label: 佐波理
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 56th  . Nara National Museum . 2004
説明文: A metal alloy combing about 80% copper, 20%tin and some lead, sahari is yellowish gold in color and gives a beautiful ring when struck. The term sahari probably comes from Silla, but one explanation places its roots in Persia. Sahari is used to make various table dishes and Buddhist implements.
